title: Why Unpaid Labor Is More Likely to Hurt Women’s Mental Health Than Men’s
description: Women generally have long hours of housework and care duties on top of a job, while men have less time-sensitive chores like lawn mowing.
dc:creator: Claire Cain Miller
media:credit: Maggie Steber for The New York Times
media:description: One study found that, among household chores, dishwashing by men was most consequential for women’s happiness in the relationship.
